summary: Email chain from October 2020 regarding travel approval for an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York to travel to the U.K. to interview a victim/witness in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The travel is necessary to obtain the witness's statement for trial, as she will only speak in person.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York; her email approval is requested for AUSA travel to the U.K. to interview a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case; the travel is for an interview of a victim/witness in the case against her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the perpetrator; the victim/witness to be interviewed was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution team traveling to interview a witness in the case against Maxwell.
Maxwell is the defendant in a case where the victim was also a victim of Epstein, indicating their alleged association in criminal activity.

events.title: Planned AUSA Travel to U.K. for Witness Interview
events.description: Travel by an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York to the United Kingdom to conduct an in-person interview of a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The Southern District of New York sought approval in October 2020 for an AUSA to travel to the U.K. to interview a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The travel was deemed necessary because the victim/witness would only provide her statement in person, and her testimony was needed to preserve the government's right to use her at trial.
The witness was identified as a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, linking the Maxwell prosecution directly to Epstein's crimes.
Audrey Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, was the approving authority for the travel request.
